meanings.definition: To divide into two equal parts
meanings.sent1: She was bisecting the cake to share it with her friend.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained the concept of bisecting a line in geometry class.
meanings.sent3: The magician performed a trick by bisecting a rope and then magically joining it back together.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to bisect the forest, creating two distinct halves.
meanings.sent5: The surgeon skillfully performed the bisecting incision during the operation.

meanings.sent1: The bisecting line on the map separated the two territories.
meanings.sent2: The bisecting mirror perfectly reflected the image on both sides.
meanings.sent3: The bisecting wall in the room gave it a unique and symmetrical look.
meanings.sent4: The bisecting road led to two different neighborhoods with equal distances.
meanings.sent5: The bisecting tree trunk stood tall in the middle of the forest.
